item.title: W3 Total Cache plugin flaw exposes 1 million WordPress sites to attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A severe flaw in the W3 Total Cache plugin installed on more than one million WordPress sites could give attackers access to various information, including metadata on cloud-based apps. [...]

item.title: Microsoft expands testing of Windows 11 admin protection feature
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has expanded its Windows 11 administrator protection tests, allowing Insiders to enable the security feature from the Windows Security settings. [...]

item.title: US cracks down on North Korean IT worker army with more sanctions
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned a network of individuals and front companies linked to North Korea's Ministry of National Defense that have generated revenue via illegal remote IT work schemes. [...]

item.title: Biden signs executive order to bolster national cybersecurity
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Days before leaving office, President Joe Biden signed an executive order to shore up the United States' cybersecurity by making it easier to sanction hacking groups targeting federal agencies and the nation's critical infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Wolf Haldenstein law firm says 3.5 million impacted by data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Wolf Haldenstein Adler Freeman & Herz LLP ("Wolf Haldenstein") reports it has suffered a data breach that exposed the personal information of nearly 3.5 million individuals to hackers. [...]

item.title: FTC sues GoDaddy for years of poor hosting security practices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) will require web hosting giant GoDaddy to implement basic security protections, including HTTPS APIs and mandatory multi-factor authentication, to settle charges that it failed to secure its hosting services against attacks since 2018. [...]

item.title: New UEFI Secure Boot flaw exposes systems to bootkits, patch now
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new UEFI Secure Boot bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-7344 that affects a Microsoft-signed application could be exploited to deploy bootkits even if Secure Boot protection is active. [...]

item.title: MFA Failures - The Worst is Yet to Come
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Token
item.description: This article delves into the rising tide of MFA failures, the alarming role of generative AI in amplifying these attacks, the growing user discontent weakening our defenses, and the glaring vulnerabilities being frequently exploited. The storm is building, and the worst is yet to come. [...]

item.title: Hackers leak configs and VPN credentials for 15,000 FortiGate devices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new hacking group has leaked the configuration files, IP addresses, and VPN credentials for over 15,000 FortiGate devices for free on the dark web, exposing a great deal of sensitive technical information to other cybercriminals. [...]

item.title: SAP fixes critical vulnerabilities in NetWeaver application servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SAP has fixed two critical vulnerabilities affecting NetWeaver web application server that could be exploited to escalate privileges and access restricted information. [...]

item.title: CISA shares guidance for Microsoft expanded logging capabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​CISA shared guidance for government agencies and enterprises on using expanded cloud logs in their Microsoft 365 tenants as part of their forensic and compliance investigations. [...]

item.title: MikroTik botnet uses misconfigured SPF DNS records to spread malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly discovered botnet of 13,000 MikroTik devices uses a misconfiguration in domain name server records to bypass email protections and deliver malware by spoofing roughly 20,000 web domains. [...]

item.title: Label giant Avery says website hacked to steal credit cards
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Avery Products Corporation is warning it suffered a data breach after its website was hacked to steal customers' credit cards and personal information. [...]
